required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laparoscopic Exploration Versus Abdominal CT Scan
clinical_study.official_title: Laparoscopic Exploration Versus Abdominal CT Scanning in Abdominal Trauma

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the efficacy and safety of laparoscopy and it's role with blunt abdominal trauma

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluate the role of laparoscopy and Abdominal Ct scan in diagnosis and treatment of abdominal trauma and which is more effective and safe laparoscopy or CT

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the role of laparoscopy in diagnosis and management of abdominal trauma
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the efficacy and safety of laparoscopy in diagnosis of abdominal trauma in comparison to abdominal CT scanning in 30 stable patients with with abdominal trauma

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the role of Abdominal CT scanning in diagnosis of abdominal trauma
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the accuracy of CT scanning in diagnosis of abdominal trauma according to 1- age of the patient 2- amount of dye 3- general conditions of the patient 4- history of medical disease

arm_group.description: Usage of laparoscopy after inflation of co2 infra umbilical

intervention.description: Laparoscopic insertion with carbon dioxide via open technique at the umbilicus

study_pop.textblock: Stable patients with abdominal trauma with good general conditions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- stable patients with definite occurrence of intra-abdominal injury
- patients with equivocal result by clinical and radiological evaluation
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with penetrating abdominal trauma
- stable patients not in need for any intervention for conservative management
- patients with marked haemodynamic instability
- polyt-traumatized Patients
